title: Retro Lawn & Garden Tools
description: From push mowers to sprinklers, test your memories of backyard upkeep

questions.question: What type of lawn mower, powered entirely by pushing, used a rotating reel of blades to cut grass?
What oscillating lawn sprinkler, featuring a long bar that swept back and forth, was a common sight on suburban lawns in the 1950s and 1960s?
What hand tool with long handles and a scissor-like cutting action was used to trim hedge bushes?
What popular brand of riding lawn mower, with its distinctive green and yellow colors, became synonymous with lawn care?
What was the long-handled, fan-shaped tool used every autumn to gather fallen leaves?
What fertilizer spreader, pushed by hand across the lawn, was commonly used by suburban homeowners in the 1960s?
What was the common manual tool used to cut lawn edges along sidewalks and driveways before electric edgers?
What iconic Sears brand produced many of the tools and mowers found in American garages and sheds?
What spinning lawn sprinkler, shaped like a tractor or animal figure, delighted children who ran through its spray?
What garden tool with a flat blade and long handle was used to turn over soil in the vegetable garden?
What motorized string trimmer, introduced by Weed Eater in 1972, revolutionized lawn edging?
What common garden pest control method involved mixing powder from a canister and spraying it with a hand-pump sprayer?
What wheelbarrow-like device with a hopper was used to spread seed or fertilizer evenly over a lawn?
What long-handled cutting tool with a curved blade was traditionally used to cut tall grass and weeds by swinging it in an arc?
What Toro product, introduced in the 1950s, became one of the first popular consumer power lawn mowers?
